00032 /* ~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=
00033  *   MRFI (Minimal RF Interface)
00034  *   Radios: CC2500, CC1100, CC1101
00035  *   SPI interface code.

00037  */

00039 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00040  *                                          Includes
00041  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00042  */
00043 #include "bsp_external/mrfi_board_defs.h"
00044 #include "mrfi_spi.h"
00045 
00046 
00047 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048  *                                            Defines
00049  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00050  */
00051 #define DUMMY_BYTE                  0xDB
00052 
00053 #define READ_BIT                    0x80
00054 #define BURST_BIT                   0x40
00055 
00056 
00057 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00058  *                                            Macros
00059  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00060  */
00061 #define MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_ON()        MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_LOW()
00062 #define MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_OFF()       MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_HIGH()
00063 #define MRFI_SPI_CHIP_SELECT_IS_OFF()         MRFI_SPI_CSN_IS_HIGH()
00064 
00065 #define MRFI_SPI_DEBUG
00066 #ifdef MRFI_SPI_DEBUG
00067 #define MRFI_SPI_ASSERT(x)      BSP_ASSERT(x)
00068 #else
00069 #define MRFI_SPI_ASSERT(x)
00070 #endif

00073 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074  *                                       Local Prototypes
00075  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076  */
00077 static uint8_t spiRegAccess(uint8_t addrByte, uint8_t writeValue);
00078 static void spiBurstFifoAccess(uint8_t addrByte, uint8_t * pData, uint8_t len);

00081 /**************************************************************************************************
00082  * @fn          mrfiSpiInit
00083  *
00084  * @brief       Initialize SPI.
00085  *
00086  * @param       none
00087  *
00088  * @return      none
00089  **************************************************************************************************
00090  */
00091 void mrfiSpiInit(void)
00092 {
00093   /* configure all SPI related pins */
00094   MRFI_SPI_CONFIG_CSN_PIN_AS_OUTPUT();
00095   MRFI_SPI_CONFIG_SCLK_PIN_AS_OUTPUT();
00096   MRFI_SPI_CONFIG_SI_PIN_AS_OUTPUT();
00097   MRFI_SPI_CONFIG_SO_PIN_AS_INPUT();
00098 
00099   /* set CSn to default high level */
00100   MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_HIGH();
00101 
00102   /* initialize the SPI registers */
00103   MRFI_SPI_INIT();
00104 }
00105

00107 /**************************************************************************************************
00108  * @fn          mrfiSpiCmdStrobe
00109  *
00110  * @brief       Send command strobe to the radio.  Returns status byte read during transfer
00111  *              of strobe command.
00112  *
00113  * @param       addr - address of register to strobe
00114  *
00115  * @return      status byte of radio
00116  **************************************************************************************************
00117  */
00118 uint8_t mrfiSpiCmdStrobe(uint8_t addr)
00119 {
00120   uint8_t statusByte;
00121   mrfiSpiIState_t s;
00122 
00123   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT( MRFI_SPI_IS_INITIALIZED() );       /* SPI is not initialized */
00124   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT((addr >= 0x30) && (addr <= 0x3D));  /* invalid address */
00125 
00126   /* disable interrupts that use SPI */
00127   MRFI_SPI_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00128 
00129   /* turn chip select "off" and then "on" to clear any current SPI access */
00130   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_OFF();
00131   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_ON();
00132 
00133   /* send the command strobe, wait for SPI access to complete */
00134   MRFI_SPI_WRITE_BYTE(addr);
00135   MRFI_SPI_WAIT_DONE();
00136 
00137   /* read the readio status byte returned by the command strobe */
00138   statusByte = MRFI_SPI_READ_BYTE();
00139 
00140   /* turn off chip select; enable interrupts that call SPI functions */
00141   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_OFF();
00142   MRFI_SPI_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00143 
00144   /* return the status byte */
00145   return(statusByte);
00146 }
00147 
00148 
00149 /**
00150  ************************************************************************************************
00151  * @fn          mrfiSpiReadReg
00152  *
00153  * @brief       Read value from radio register.
00154  *
00155  * @param       addr - address of register
00156  *
00157  * @return      register value
00158  **************************************************************************************************
00159  */
00160 uint8_t mrfiSpiReadReg(uint8_t addr)
00161 {
00162   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT(addr <= 0x3B);    /* invalid address */
00163 
00164   /*
00165    *  The burst bit is set to allow access to read-only status registers.
00166    *  This does not affect normal register reads.
00167    */
00168   return( spiRegAccess(addr | BURST_BIT | READ_BIT, DUMMY_BYTE) );
00169 }
00170 
00171 
00172 /**
00173  ************************************************************************************************
00174  * @fn          mrfiSpiWriteReg
00175  *
00176  * @brief       Write value to radio register.
00177  *
00178  * @param       addr  - address of register
00179  * @param       value - register value to write
00180  *
00181  * @return      none
00182  **************************************************************************************************
00183  */
00184 void mrfiSpiWriteReg(uint8_t addr, uint8_t value)
00185 {
00186   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT((addr <= 0x2E) || (addr == 0x3E));    /* invalid address */
00187 
00188   spiRegAccess(addr, value);
00189 }
00190 
00191 
00192 /*=================================================================================================
00193  * @fn          spiRegAccess
00194  *
00195  * @brief       This function performs a read or write.  The
00196  *              calling code must configure the read/write bit of the register's address byte.
00197  *              This bit is set or cleared based on the type of access.
00198  *
00199  * @param       regAddrByte - address byte of register; the read/write bit already configured
00200  *
00201  * @return      register value
00202  *=================================================================================================
00203  */
00204 static uint8_t spiRegAccess(uint8_t addrByte, uint8_t writeValue)
00205 {
00206   uint8_t readValue;
00207   mrfiSpiIState_t s;
00208 
00209   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT( MRFI_SPI_IS_INITIALIZED() );   /* SPI is not initialized */
00210 
00211   /* disable interrupts that use SPI */
00212   MRFI_SPI_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00213 
00214   /* turn chip select "off" and then "on" to clear any current SPI access */
00215   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_OFF();
00216   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_ON();
00217 
00218   /* send register address byte, the read/write bit is already configured */
00219   MRFI_SPI_WRITE_BYTE(addrByte);
00220   MRFI_SPI_WAIT_DONE();
00221 
00222   /*
00223    *  Send the byte value to write.  If this operation is a read, this value
00224    *  is not used and is just dummy data.  Wait for SPI access to complete.
00225    */
00226   MRFI_SPI_WRITE_BYTE(writeValue);
00227   MRFI_SPI_WAIT_DONE();
00228 
00229   /*
00230    *  If this is a read operation, SPI data register now contains the register
00231    *  value which will be returned.  For a read operation, it contains junk info
00232    *  that is not used.
00233    */
00234   readValue = MRFI_SPI_READ_BYTE();
00235 
00236   /* turn off chip select; enable interrupts that call SPI functions */
00237   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_OFF();
00238   MRFI_SPI_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00239 
00240   /* return the register value */
00241   return(readValue);
00242 }
00243 
00244 
00245 /**************************************************************************************************
00246  * @fn          mrfiSpiWriteTxFifo
00247  *
00248  * @brief       Write data to radio transmit FIFO.
00249  *
00250  * @param       pData - pointer for storing write data
00251  * @param       len   - length of data in bytes
00252  *
00253  * @return      none
00254  **************************************************************************************************
00255  */
00256 void mrfiSpiWriteTxFifo(uint8_t * pData, uint8_t len)
00257 {
00258   spiBurstFifoAccess(TXFIFO | BURST_BIT, pData, len);
00259 }
00260 
00261 
00262 /**************************************************************************************************
00263  * @fn          macSpiReadRxFifo
00264  *
00265  * @brief       Read data from radio receive FIFO.
00266  *
00267  * @param       pData - pointer for storing read data
00268  * @param       len   - length of data in bytes
00269  *
00270  * @return      none
00271  **************************************************************************************************
00272  */
00273 void mrfiSpiReadRxFifo(uint8_t * pData, uint8_t len)
00274 {
00275   spiBurstFifoAccess(RXFIFO | BURST_BIT | READ_BIT, pData, len);
00276 }
00277 
00278 
00279 /*=================================================================================================
00280  * @fn          spiBurstFifoAccess
00281  *
00282  * @brief       Burst mode access used for reading or writing to radio FIFOs.
00283  *
00284  *              For more efficient interrupt latency, this function does not keep interrupts
00285  *              disabled for its entire execution.  It is designed to recover if an interrupt
00286  *              occurs that accesses SPI.  See comments in code for further details.
00287  *
00288  * @param       addrByte - first byte written to SPI, contains address and mode bits
00289  * @param       pData    - pointer to data to read or write
00290  * @param       len      - length of data in bytes
00291  *
00292  * @return      none
00293  *=================================================================================================
00294  */
00295 static void spiBurstFifoAccess(uint8_t addrByte, uint8_t * pData, uint8_t len)
00296 {
00297   mrfiSpiIState_t s;
00298 
00299   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT( MRFI_SPI_IS_INITIALIZED() );   /* SPI is not initialized */
00300   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT(len != 0);                      /* zero length is not allowed */
00301   MRFI_SPI_ASSERT(addrByte & BURST_BIT);          /* only burst mode supported */
00302 
00303   /* disable interrupts that use SPI */
00304   MRFI_SPI_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00305 
00306   /* turn chip select "off" and then "on" to clear any current SPI access */
00307   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_OFF();
00308   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_ON();
00309 
00310   /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00311    *  Main loop.  If the SPI access is interrupted, execution comes back to
00312    *  the start of this loop.  Loop exits when nothing left to transfer.
00313    */
00314   do
00315   {
00316     /* send FIFO access command byte, wait for SPI access to complete */
00317     MRFI_SPI_WRITE_BYTE(addrByte);
00318     MRFI_SPI_WAIT_DONE();
00319 
00320     /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00321      *  Inner loop.  This loop executes as long as the SPI access is not interrupted.
00322      *  Loop completes when nothing left to transfer.
00323      */
00324     do
00325     {
00326       MRFI_SPI_WRITE_BYTE(*pData);
00327 
00328       /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00329        *  Use idle time.  Perform increment/decrement operations before pending on
00330        *  completion of SPI access.
00331        *
00332        *  Decrement the length counter.  Wait for SPI access to complete.
00333        */
00334       len--;
00335       MRFI_SPI_WAIT_DONE();
00336 
00337       /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00338        *  SPI data register holds data just read.  If this is a read operation,
00339        *  store the value into memory.
00340        */
00341       if (addrByte & READ_BIT)
00342       {
00343         *pData = MRFI_SPI_READ_BYTE();
00344       }
00345 
00346       /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00347        *  At least one byte of data has transferred.  Briefly enable (and then disable)
00348        *  interrupts that can call SPI functions.  This provides a window for any timing
00349        *  critical interrupts that might be pending.
00350        *
00351        *  To improve latency, take care of pointer increment within the interrupt
00352        *  enabled window.
00353        */
00354       MRFI_SPI_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00355       pData++;
00356       MRFI_SPI_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00357 
00358       /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00359        *  If chip select is "off" the SPI access was interrupted (all SPI access
00360        *  functions leave chip select in the "off" state).  In this case, turn
00361        *  back on chip select and break to the main loop.  The main loop will
00362        *  pick up where the access was interrupted.
00363        */
00364       if (MRFI_SPI_CHIP_SELECT_IS_OFF())
00365       {
00366         MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_ON();
00367         break;
00368       }
00369 
00370     /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00371      */
00372     } while (len); /* inner loop */
00373   } while (len);   /* main loop */
00374 
00375   /* turn off chip select; enable interrupts that call SPI functions */
00376   MRFI_SPI_TURN_CHIP_SELECT_OFF();
00377   MRFI_SPI_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00378 }
00379
